subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests
msgSnippet: ... Interesting. Like I said, I ll have to dig out more. I _really_ want to know how it knows what the right parameter value is. -- Software is too expensive
messageBody:
On 20/10/05, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> Very cool. It works because it happens to survive this code from
> RemoteTestRunner.java:
>
> Class[] classArgs= { String.class };
> //...
> constructor= testClass.getConstructor(classArgs);
>
> I'm sure the original intent was simply to handle the standard override
> of TestCase(String name), but the fact that it works for any test class
> with a String constructor might be a huge help for others using
> parameterized classes.

Interesting. Like I said, I'll have to dig out more. I _really_ want
to know how it knows what the right parameter value is.

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
